See also: toilette and toiletté
German Wikipedia has an article on:
Toilette
Wikipedia de

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from French toilette, diminutive of toile, from Latin tēla, from texō.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /to̯aˈlɛtə/ (prescriptive standard)
  • IPA(key): /toˈlɛtə/ (more common)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Toilette f (genitive Toilette, plural Toiletten)

  1. toilet
  2. toilette

Synonyms[edit]

  • (toilet): Klo (informal)
